title: Expenditure defrayable by the Union or a State out of its revenues
text:
The Union or a State may make any grants for any public purpose, notwithstanding that the purpose is not one with respect to which Parliament or the Legislature of the State, as the case may be, may make laws.
SUMMARY
10 August 1949
. It allowed the Union or State to make grants for any public purposes.
There was no debate on this article and it was
adopted
as is on the same day.
